job_description: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, ROS Experience - job post Roblox 34 reviews San Mateo, CA 94401 $218,540 - $283,780 a year -  Internship You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $218,540 - $283,780 a year Job Type Internship Every day, tens of millions of people come to Roblox to explore, create, play, learn, and connect with friends in 3D immersive digital experiences– all created by our global community of developers and creators. At Roblox, we're building the tools and platform that empower our community to bring any experience that they can imagine to life. Our vision is to reimagine the way people come together, from anywhere in the world, and on any device. We're on a mission to connect a billion people with optimism and civility, and looking for amazing talent to help us get there. A career at Roblox means you'll be working to shape the future of human interaction, solving unique technical challenges at scale, and helping to create safer, more civil shared experiences for everyone. ROS Experiences is a new team working across two exciting projects with more expected as we continue to grow. Multiple projects will add variety to our team members' day-to-day work, regularly offering them new and interesting challenges. Our work on Assessment Tools has proven immensely successful in vetting the best NCG and Intern candidates and will only grow going forward. Our newest project, Roblox Office, is only just ramping up and those that join will be on the ground floor of helping define the future of work and collaboration within the Roblox ecosystem. We are one of very few groups within the company that use Roblox's external facing tools to develop and deploy to the Roblox platform. As such, we are able to help shape the future technologies that Roblox will provide to its Creators. You Are Passionate about and an expert at building web applications and knowledgeable with front and back-end technologies A technical contributor that can translate product requirements into scalable architecture Proficient in writing readable, extensible, modular, and testable code Effective at collaborating with individuals from all disciplines Able to work in a fast paced environment with competing priorities Comfortable working across multiple teams to make pragmatic tradeoffs and quick decisions You Will Translate product designs into accessible user experiences Build and maintain internal component libraries Build and maintain backend systems inside and outside of the Roblox ecosystem Collaborate with many disciplines to build experiences in Roblox Studio to run on the Roblox platform Architect and build systems and user facing features Work closely with live-ops and the rest of the technical team to maintain multiple, always-on, products Mentor other engineers as well as non-technical team members You Have BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience 3+ years of experience working as a software engineer Experience with one or more modern front-end web frameworks Expertise with 2+ programming languages Bonus: Experience with Roblox Studio or other game engine editors Bonus: Experience developing game systems and architecture For roles that are based at our headquarters in San Mateo, CA: The starting base pay for this position is as shown below. The actual base pay is dependent upon a variety of job-related factors such as professional background, training, work experience, location, business needs and market demand. Therefore, in some circumstances, the actual salary could fall outside of this expected range. This pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All full-time employees are also eligible for equity compensation and for benefits. Annual Salary Range $218,540—$283,780 USD You'll Love: Industry-leading compensation package Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage A rewarding 401k program Flexible vacation policy Roflex - Flexible and supportive work policy Roblox Admin badge for your avatar At Roblox HQ: Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks Onsite fitness center and fitness program credit Annual CalTrain Go Pass Roblox provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Site Reliability Engineer - job post Trade Terminal San Francisco Bay Area, CA $75,000 - $125,000 a year -  Full-time, Internship Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $75,000 - $125,000 a year Job Type Full-time Internship SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) As an SRE, your job responsibilities include: 1. Responsible for the design and development of the overall automated operation and maintenance platform of the system; 2. Responsible for the promotion, application and operational support of the DevOps platform, and assist the R&D team to use DevOps products to improve performance and use them efficiently DevOps toolchain; 3. Familiar with docker/k8s container, and perform exception handling and analysis Understand jenkins/git and other related technologies 4. Responsible for following up the collection, construction and optimization of project operation and maintenance requirements; 5. Familiar with the architecture and working principles of virtualization platforms such as KVM/docker, and understand the principles of OpenStack/vmware 6. Familiar with the principles and deployment of middleware applications such as zookeeper/ ELK/RabbitMQ and the deployment of ansible batch configuration and management tools And optimization management, can use Zabbix to monitor the system, network and service. As an SRE, you will need to meet the following job requirements: 1. Bachelor degree or above in computer-related majors, at least 3 years of practical experience in application operation and maintenance or R&D experience in operation and maintenance automation platforms, familiar with software development and system architecture; 2. Proficient in development languages ​​and technologies such as python/shell, familiar with distributed framework and microservice architecture, and proficient in application operation and maintenance links; 3. Familiar with system tools and processes related to operation and maintenance, familiar with DEVOPS/CI/CD, etc., and have corresponding secondary development capabilities, such as: changing the system, Promethus system monitoring system, etc.; 4. Physical host io performance, network bandwidth, memory exception and hard disk fault handling, summary of fault handling report feedback Job Types: Full-time, Internship Pay: $75,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year Physical setting: Office Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): What is your experience with AWS, especially with EC2, S3, VOC and IAM? Do you have any experience with Kubernetes, specifically with 100+ launches over the past 2 years? Do you have any relevant experience with virtual machines? If so, please briefly describe. Would you please give us a concise and short summary of your OpenStack experience? Experience: LAN/DNS/VPN/DHCP (Required) Work Location: In person If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Sr. Full Stack Developer - job post AlignTech 161 reviews San Jose, CA 95134 $164,800 - $198,000 a year -  Internship You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $164,800 - $198,000 a year Job Type Internship Join a team that is changing millions of lives. Transforming smiles, changing lives. At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Ready to join us? About this opportunity The Sr. Full Stack Developer - Monetization is responsible for successful design and development of web applications and micro services. This role will be a strong contributor in the execution of the strategic direction for the company, the success of this position will be measured by the usability, quality, and timeliness of applications delivery In this role, you will… As a global role, work closely with internal and external stakeholders of Align including Regulatory, Commercial, Marketing, Product, Finance and Operations across different geographical regions to gather and analyze global and regional requirements to meet the system and application needs of business for mission critical and strategic enterprise business functions and projects. Lead the design and development of new applications and architectures using Ruby on Rails. Work with software and product teams to determine new features and establish sprint goals. Develop intuitive web-based user interfaces, applications, and web service integration APIs using Ruby on Rails and REACT. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code using Ruby on Rails and front-end frameworks. Ensure code quality by writing automated tests and conducting code reviews. Design and develop scalable data models for new and existing applications including microservices architecture. Work with tertiary groups such as Security, Architecture, IT Operations, and QA to ensure quality design, delivery, and adherence to corporate standards. Work with business owners to propose high-quality user experience solutions for desktop and mobile web applications. Research and evaluate new technologies and frameworks to determine feasibility and impact on the business. In this role, you’ll need … Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Information Systems or related field 8-12 years of overall software development experience and scalable web applications with backend as Ruby on Rails and front-end frameworks like REACT, Next.JS, HTML5, DOM, JavaScript, CSS, etc. Experience designing and building the full stack architecture Experience in PostgreSQL skills, including database design and optimization Experience with Git source control and effective branching and release management practice Experience building API-driven applications or endpoints Experience in cloud deployment - AWS Amplify, EC2, Elastic Beanstalk, S3 Nice to have: Experience with cloud-based infrastructure (Aliyun, Heroku, Amazon) Experience working with the global team as a plus Experience with automation frameworks and testing tools Familiarity with other languages such as Python/GoLang is welcome Familiarity with Payments processes and fintech integrations is a big plus Good communication skills and teamwork skills, open-minded and tolerant, with a high sense of responsibility, positive and rigorous to work, good at thinking and brave to take responsibility Sound like a good fit? Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network. About Align Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives . Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials. By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work. We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information. Global Diversity Statement: At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time. Equal Opportunity Statement It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Primary Location Base Salary Range: $164,800 to $198,000 USD Base salary ranges are a guideline used to determine appropriate pay. Placement depends on the individual skills and experience level of a candidate plus the total compensation and equity across team members. For other locations outside of the primary location, the base salary range will be adjusted geographically. For field Sales roles, the salary listed is the base pay only and does not include the applicable commission plan. A cost of living adjustment may be added to base pay for higher cost areas in the U.S. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

DevOps Engineer - job post AlignTech 161 reviews San Jose, CA 95134 • Hybrid remote $144,600 - $165,500 a year -  Internship You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $144,600 - $165,500 a year Job Type Internship Join a team that is changing millions of lives. Transforming smiles, changing lives. At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Ready to join us? About this opportunity The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the designing and implementing tasks that supports Consumer Web/API Team for Align Technology. The Consumer Applications Devops Engineer is responsible for building APIs and maintaining the build and deploy process of existing applications using AWS infrastructure and Kubernetes. As a Devops Engineer, the candidate will be a strong contributor in the execution of the strategic direction for the company, the success of this position will be measured by the usability, quality, and timeliness of applications delivery. You will participate on building apis, establishing the build scripts and maintaining the applications. The ideal candidate is expected to have proven extensive experience in API building, AWS infrastructure management and Kubernetes setup. In this role, you will… Manage cloud infrastructure and services through the use and promotion of Infrastructure-as-Code tools. Responsible or building API’s using Python & Fast API Collaborate with development teams on implementing deployment and packaging automation for their apps using Fargate (AWS ECS, EKS), Docker, Cold containers, or other appropriate technologies. Design, build and manage ELK /Open search clusters for centralized logging and search functionalities. Build out and maintain Kubernetes Infrastructure and CI/CD for developers. Advocate and implement the use of reliable design patterns across the software organization Improve the monitoring and observability of services and their health Enable self-service deploys and service requests to continually reduce deployment toil Manage changes according to change management policies and processes and adhere to established change management and change control systems. Provide support to CICD method and help with standardizing and automating workflows and tasks. Participate in strategic projects to improve Aligns approach to cloud-based infrastructure and application deployment. Develop solutions to automate repetitive tasks, monitor system health, create, and update real-time inventories and reports, and improve existing processes. Responsible for working with business owners to propose high-quality user experience solutions for desktop and mobile web applications. Responsible for working with the configuration management and administration teams to provide accurate build and deployment instructions. Responsible for working with tertiary groups such as Security, Architecture, IT Operations, and QA to ensure quality design, delivery, and adherence to corporate standards. Ensure application development principles, standards, and best practices are followed for each project. Provide support to audit processes and quality management system as required. In this role, you’ll need … Educational Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent years of experience Masters will be preferred. Required Experience: 5+ years of Software or System Engineering experience. 4+ Experience with Cloud Computing with AWS & GCP. 4+ Experience with Docker, Kubernetes. 4 years of overall web development experience, preferably secure, scalable web applications in Java, Node or Python Strong Experience working as DevOps engineer with focus on automation. Strong Experience with Infrastructure as Code using tool like CloudFormation or Terraform Strong Experience with CICD tool/pipeline (Bamboo, Jenkins), Configuration management (Chef, Ansible) and version control (Git). Experience with Build and Release process. Experience with Monitoring and Alerting tools like Open Search, Splunk, New Relic. Expertise with cloud security, understand the principle of least privilege. Ability to document complex architectural concepts and solutions in both business and technical terms. Proven strong skills in critical thinking and analysis, verbal and written communications, and interpersonal interactions. Proven track record of working in an agile methodology and knowledgeable with SCRUM framework. Required Technical Skills Basic understanding of System engineering concepts like load balancing, capacity planning, firewalls, SSL etc. 3+ years of experience with Terraform or Chef. 3+ years of experience with container orchestration services including Docker or Kubernetes Experience with Atlassian toolsets a plus. AWS Solution Architect (Associate or Pro) certification is preferred. AWS Certified SysOps Administrator certification is preferred. AWS Certified DevOps Engineer is a plus. Required Soft Skills Team Player. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Effective communications. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Self-Motivated and Independent worker. Customer focus – takes ownership of issues and seeing issues through to resolution. Sound like a good fit? Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit?
